metadata.title: CVE-2011-1059 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in WebCore in WebKit before r77705, as used inGoogle Chrome before 11.0.672.2 and other products, allows user-assistedremote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via vectors that entice a user toresubmit a form, related to improper handling of provisional items by theHistoryController component, aka rdar problem 8938557.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0.696.68~r84545-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
